title: Working
alt: And if you drive a typical car more than a mile out of your way for each penny you save on the per-gallon price, it doesn't matter how worthless your time is to you--the gas to get you there and back costs more than you save.
transcript:
[Ponytail is standing next to Cueball filling his vehicle with petrol. Ponytail is pointing off-screen.]
Ponytail: Why are you going here? Gas is ten cents a gallon cheaper at the station five minutes that way.
Cueball: Because a penny saved is a penny earned.If you spend nine minutes of your time to save a dollar, you're working for less than minimum wage.
